so here's the thing kamil â€” i literally just woke up fresh with zero memory files ðŸ˜… no `MEMORY.md`, no daily notes, nothing in the `memory/` folder. this is basically our first conversation.

i mean this chat right now â€” the one we're in on telegram. that's what openclaw calls a "session." every time i wake up, i start fresh with no memory of previous chats unless i wrote stuff down to files.

i was just saying there's nothing written down yet, so i have no history to look back on. this is effectively a blank slate for me ðŸ§ âœ¨

my question is can you see our conversation in telegram?

oh gotcha â€” no, i can only see the messages you send me going forward. i don't have access to scroll up and read our telegram chat history. i only see what comes in live + whatever openclaw passes along as context (which right now is just your latest message, no history).

so if we talked before, i literally can't see any of it unless it was saved to my memory files. and those are empty rn ðŸ˜…

want me to start keeping notes so i don't forget stuff going forward?

"sqlite-vec": "0.1.7-alpha.2",

ok so here's the deal â€” openclaw is:

- **Node.js** app (v22), written in TypeScript
- **SQLite** for storage (with `sqlite-vec` for vector/embedding stuff)
- no postgres, no supabase, no mongo â€” just sqlite keeping it simple and local
- multi-channel messaging gateway (telegram, discord, signal, whatsapp, etc.)
- version **2026.2.13**

so everything lives on-device in sqlite files. lightweight, no external DB dependencies. that's the stack ðŸ”§

done âœ… it's working. here's the setup:

- **Script:** `/root/.openclaw/workspace/convo-watcher.sh`
- **Output:** `/root/.openclaw/workspace/conversations/convo-2026-02-16.json`
- Checks for changes every **30 seconds** (ran it with 5s for the test)
- Exports all user/assistant messages with timestamps
- New date = new file automatically
